item.title: Phoebe Kate add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Phoebe Kate add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Phoebe Kate add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying. " -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Phoebe Kate add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "The most efficient way of rendering the poor harmless is to teach them to want to imitate the rich." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Phoebe Kate add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Phoebe Kate add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Television is the Antichrist, and I can assure you after only three or four generations, people will no longer even know how to fart on their own and humans will return to medieval savagery and to the general state of imbecility that slugs overcame back in the Pleistocene era. Our world will not die as a result of the bomb...it will die of laughter, of banality, of making a joke of everything and a lousy joke at that." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Phoebe Kate add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "One of the pitfalls of childhood is that one doesn't have to understand something to feel it. By the time the mind is able to comprehend what has happened, the wounds of the heart are already too deep." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Phoebe Kate add a quote by Arthur Koestler
item.description: "The principal mark of genius is not perfection but originality, the opening of new frontiers." -- Arthur Koestler
